articles.title: To understand causes of bladder cancer, scientists recreate DNA damage caused by toxins from smoking - New Kerala
articles.description: In a bid to understand more about the causes of bladder cancer, researchers recreated DNA damage caused by toxins from smoking....
articles.content: The causes of bladder cancer remain largely unknown, however, smoking is seen as the main risk factor for the disease.Researchers - led by Dr Simon Baker from the Department of Biology - grew human bladder tissues in the laboratory and exposed them to a commo… [+1514 chars]

articles.title: Why does COVID-19 affect old people more than young people?. - Brinkwire
articles.content:
As we age, our lung tissue becomes stifferand this is a phenomenon that SARS-CoV-2 may be exploiting. Caroline Uhler and G. V. Shivashankar outline their hypothesis.
